intro: Basiphyllaea, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants typically grow in sandy or gravelly soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are characterized by their small, often blue or violet flowers and hairy foliage. Basiphyllaea species are generally shrubs or subshrubs with a compact growth habit.
